climbs.name: Thumper
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start up a few steep blocks to gain excellent stone.  Climb up the corner to a big  roof and hand traverse left until you can pull past the roof to a stance.  Continue on thin face climbing to the anchors.

climbs.name: Shed Your Skin
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description:
<not pictured>

Starts between two Junipers.  Difficult climbing down low on so-so rock leads to fun moves on much better rock for the upper half of the climb.

climbs.name: She Fuckin’ Hates It
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description:
Climb up steep tan rock with edges and a pocket or two and pull onto a stance. Move right on a slab under a roof and make a blind reach

around the corner. Pull though and cruise to the anchors.

climbs.name: Ph – Bomb
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb the face to the right of the big triangular shaped roof.  A hard move off the ground leads to a stance below a block.  After the block, climb a crack/corner and move left to the anchors.

climbs.name: Ms. Smiley
climbs.fa: Bolted by Andrew Thaller, FA by Andrew Thaller

content.description: Start with big moves through overhanging territory.  Gain a stance and work up to an amazing smile shaped hueco and jug hauling to the top. Fun climbing.

climbs.name: Maker’s Mark
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Boulder up to or stick clip the first bolt.  Continue up steep blocks to a knee bar under a roof.  Climb up and right the overhang to small edges. Pull your feet up and continue on a nice brown face to the anchors.

climbs.name: Lip Service
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start on a grey face and move up and left to an awkward stance below a 4 foot roof. Make a burly move over the roof to a nice brown face and finish with a few thin moves.

climbs.name: Justified
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description:
<not pictured>

Climb up to a small roof below a steep corner, make some big moves to gain a stance.  Easier climbing up and right leads to the anchors.

climbs.name: It's Getting Better All the Time
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2020

content.description: Make an awkward move into a sandy left facing corner.  Step right to a stance.  Move more or less straight up steep, excellent quality rock on crimps and pockets.  Keep moving up steep terrain until it backs off at the anchors.
content.location: Just to the left of Shed Your Skin.  Look for the name tag at the base of the climb.

climbs.name: In the Line of Fire
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Climb up a left facing corner to a ledge below an arête.  Climb either side of the arête to the anchors.

Likely an old Joel Jackson route.  Bolt added down low and the anchor was moved (the old anchor is in a block on the ground now!).  Climb up a nice looking corner system to anchors below a large tree on the rim.

climbs.name: Godzilla
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Work up to a big roof through very steep terrain on widely spaced but decent holds.  Wrestle though the weakness in the roof to a huge ledge.  A few move easy moves lead to the anchors.

climbs.name: Get Down to Get Up
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Mirror image climb of Thumper. Move up to the big corner and traverse right under the big roof until you can pull around the roof to a stance. Continue up to the anchors.

climbs.name: Falling Star
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start just right of Lip Service in the grey corner and move right to ledge below an overhanging dihedral. Make a couple of moves up the corner until you can jam the crack to the top.
Ultra thin crimps over a big roof, suspected 13.  Still waiting a clean ascent.  Comment and leave the grade if you send it.
Steep climbing leads to an obvious hueco.  A hard pull past the hueco leads to a stance & easier climbing to the anchors.  FA:  Dave Bingham, Nov 2016

Make hard moves off the ground and gain a crack to a stance.  Pull into a crack with on bad feet and move up to the featured roof. Pull the roof and make another hard move to get to the anchors.  Recommended to clip from the rim just above the anchors.

climbs.name: 2-Fer
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description:
Starts to the left and shares anchors with

DB Goes to TBC

.
